snippet: The medical records of Thomas Eric Duncan, the Liberian who died this week in Dallas, contradict earlier statements from the hospital that treated him.
abstract: Medical records of Thomas Eric Duncan, Liberian man who died of the Ebola virus, raise new questions about treatment he received when he first sought care at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas; report shows that he was sent home despite having high fever even after medical personnel learned he had recently arrived from Africa.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and KEVIN SACK
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Kevin Sack from Atlanta. Abby Goodnough contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The medical records of Thomas Eric Duncan, the Liberian who died this week in Dallas, contradict earlier statements from the hospital that treated him.

headline.main: Ebola Patient Sent Home Despite Fever, Records Show
headline.print_headline: Ebola Patient Sent Home Despite Fever, Records Show
